alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 3:27AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Christian, southeastern Caldwell, northeastern Trigg and southeastern Hopkins Counties through 315 AM CST... At 227 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cobb, or 7 miles northeast of Cadiz, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Crofton around 245 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Nortonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 61 and 66. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 104 and 107. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 40. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 18 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
